title: Does Darius suck right now or am I just bad?
body: I can't even win lane with him. It's so easy for my lane opponent to deny me my heal and even then it doesn't seem to do nearly enough damage. I also can't seem to duel anyone without losing early game (partially because it seems so hard to land Q now). And late game I hardly do enough damage to be useful to anyone and that's if I even get kills to begin with since it's so easy to escape. Even then, though, I've heard people say he's still one of the highest tier top laners especially in low elo. So is Darius really just not good right now or do I just suck at this game?

replies.body: You're just bad. He's pretty strong.

Let's try not to belittle this player.

He (or She) is probably just NEW to {{champion:122}} so they don't know all of his ins-and-outs.
So that's it then? I'm just bad at this game and should just give up?

No, most certainly not.

Sometimes, when I'm feeling off, I play some VS AI games, or now with the newly-added Practice tool, just put together a  silly Runes/Masteries setup and goof off to let off some steam. Sometimes that helps.
But I already do that and it makes absolutely no difference.

Try taking a break from playing him for a bit. I do that also when it feels like I'm in a rut.

You got any other tried-and-true Top-laners? Give them a whirl for a while, and then try your luck with him again.
darius isnt good if you ask me but you should be winning most 1v1s with him

But I can't. Either I get outduelled at early levels or I miss my Q or my Q doesn't heal me or do enough damage to have meant anything even when I do land it. And even if I do start winning I can't kill them fast enough to keep them from running away.

Well, as an L7 {{champion:122}} player and he being one of my tried-and-true picks, I can give you some pointers. But first, I need to know how you currently PLAY him and BUILD him.

What is your Runes and Masteries setup?
What skill are you taking on him first?
What is your typical build path?

If you can answers these question for me, we'll have a basic idea of where to go from here onward. Otherwise, I'll just have to guess on what you do.

Build path for me is usually {{item:3071}} > {{item:3111}} (Though I've been trying Swiftness because I can't catch up to anyone) > {{item:3742}} > {{item:3065}} > {{item:3143}} > {{item:3053}} 

Masteries are 12/0/18 with Grasp. Apparently people are taking Fervor, but I can't see why when Darius doesn't have the attack speed to abuse it.

Well, that's why I take some AS Runes and do Fervor sometimes. Not ALWAYS, it usually depends on who I'm facing and the enemy team-composition.

I tested an all AS/Tankiness Runes and Masteries idea once, like so:

9 AS Marks
5 Armor/4 Scaling Armor Seals
5 MR/ Scaling MR Glyphs
1 Flat Armor Quint
1 Flat MR Quint
1 AS Quint

18 (Fervor)/0/12 Masteries

It worked in the sense that I was able to proc Noxian Might faster than ever before. But my last-hitting suffered because of the lack of AD, so I was behind on CS and items against my opponents. So I went to this setup that is my currently tried-and-true:

5 AD Marks
4 Scaling AD Marks
1 AD Seal
4 Flat Armor Seals
3 Scaling Armor Seals
9 AS Glyphs
3 Scaling AD Quints

12/0/18 (Grasp) Masteries

That's just MY setup, you are free to do with this information as you will.

The build is a pretty standard one, and I follow a path pretty similar to that myself. There might be an item here or there that gets changed for the same reason as above with the Masteries/Runes from game to game. Perhaps you're just a little off-your-game at the moment.

Chin up! You'll get back in the groove eventually!
Wouldn't say you suck, especially if you managed L7. Maybe you're just not concentrating or your head isn't in the game lately.

It's not like I'm doing this badly with other champions, though. I've had to resort to using Xin in ranked games because I just don't trust my ability to play Darius anymore. But if he's one of the better top laners right now then I don't know why this is happening.

I dunno man, I was the same way with Maokai after playing him for a looooong while.

A large part of it could be that people are actually learning how to counter Darius now. I was getting roflstomped by him for a while till I learned things like "hug him during Q" and whatnot.
But then why would he still be a top pick if people know how to play around him?
He has one of the highest pick rates and win rates for top lane but i dont play him much so idk
